event_name: Into the Dark Woods ~ A Rite of Passage
description: A Rite of Passage Retreat with The Imaginelle Mystery School. Step into the ancient tale of Vasilisa, who journeyed into the forest to face the fierce Baba Yaga and returned with fire that burns away what is false and illuminates what is true. Together we will: Listen to the live storytelling Sit in the woods with the dark and return with light Share wisdom, reflection, and firelit nourishment Embroider white linen with red thread, weaving soul into form This is a retreat of grief, beauty, and initiation. For women who hold space that are ready to be held in the dark, reclaim the spark, and stitch it into their lives. Because even leaders need to lay it down sometimes. Even fire-keepers need to sit in the dark. Salt Spring Island · Nov 8–9 (overnight retreat) Calls: Monday evenings Nov 3 & Nov 17 inquire: ignite@naomijason.com early bird: $495 (till Oct 15) full: $595 Included: overnight sleepover optional (bring your own bedding) *upgrade to private room upon request ****** Step into the dark woods. Return with your flame. ****** There is a time when every woman is asked to walk into the unknown, to face the dark woods and the fierce questions that live there. In the old Slavic tale of Vasilisa the Beautiful, a young girl is sent into the forest to seek fire from Baba Yaga. What begins as exile becomes initiation: through tasks of patience, courage, and devotion, she returns with the fire of truth—the flame that burns away illusion and lights the way forward. This retreat is our own journey into the dark woods. Before we gather, we meet in a live storytelling call, listening to Vasilisa’s tale and naming the intentions we will carry. At retreat, we open ceremonial space, nourish our bodies, and step into the night woods to sit in silence with the unseen. From darkness we return to the fire, each woman lighting her own candle, a symbol of the spark carried home. The next morning we move and dance our bodies alive, then enter sacred craft—embroidering white linen with red thread, just as Vasalisa wove beauty from her fire. Each stitch a prayer. Each thread a continuation of the story. Afterward, we return once more in a post-retreat integration call, tending the embers and grounding the fire into our daily lives. This is a circle for women who are ready to: Sit with grief, shadow, and mystery Reclaim the fire of their own soul Weave the light into body, home, and community
location: 1361 Beaver Point, Salt Spring Island, BC V8K 1W9, CA

event_name: Aerialists (JUNO-Nominated) with Caraluna – Live on Salt Spring Island
description: A Night of Spellbinding Folk Fusion at Beaver Point Hall November 14 | Doors 6:30 PM | Caraluna 7:00 | Aerialists 8:00 $20 early-bird (limited) → $25 advance → $30 door Two of Canada’s most captivating folk acts share the Beaver Point Hall stage for an unforgettable evening of musical alchemy. Aerialists - the JUNO-nominated, award-winning “prog-trad” quintet - weave Scottish, Irish, and Nordic folk traditions into lush post-rock soundscapes with harp, fiddle, and electric textures that shimmer with precision and power. Fresh from releasing I Lost My Heart on Friday , they dissolve the lines between folk and indie rock to bring the energy of a summer festival sunset to the stage. Opening the night is Salt Spring’s own Caraluna , a multilingual indie-folk/world ensemble led by singer-songwriter Jesse Edward Thom . With Balkan-style trumpets, accordion, and pulsing rhythms wrapped around poetic, heart-opening songs, Caraluna transforms each performance into a vibrant journey — part prayer, part celebration. An evening of beauty, rhythm, and connection — two visionary bands inviting you into a world where tradition and imagination dance as one.
location: 1361 Beaver Point, Salt Spring Island, BC V8K 1W9, CA

event_name: Conscious Movement Practice with Live Shaker
dance_style: conscious movement, ecstatic dance, movement meditation
description: Step into an evening of movement with the theme of: Dancing with Shadows . This month, we invite you to explore the unseen parts, unspoken emotions, and aspects of self that linger quietly beneath the surface. Through rhythm and embodied expression, guided by Hassti Hamidi , we meet the tender, hidden layers within, allowing what has been held in silence to move, breathe, and find its way into the light. Joining us this month is special guest Ash Bigdeli, whose live shaker will deepen the experience and awaken the body’s intuitive response. Together, we invite you to move with what’s hidden, to listen with your body, and to let silence become movement. Come dance your depth, your truth, your shadow and remember: every shadow is cast by light.
location: Conscious Movement Practice with Live Shaker, 765 20th AVE E, VANCOUVER, BC, V5V1N2, CA, Unknown, BC, Canada

event_name: Barnstormer! Gatsby Glitz 'n Swingin' Hits — Live at the Odd Fellows Hall
description: Step back in time and onto the dance floor! Barnstormer Band invites you to a swingin’ Saturday night where Gatsby-era glam collides with a foot-stompin’ country twist. This imaginative, six-piece band brings the Roaring Twenties to life—hot jazz, ragtime rhythms, and jumpin’ jive with just enough grit to keep things spicy. All levels of swing dancers welcome! Whether you're a lindy hopper, Charleston chaser, or a toe-tapping beginner, this is your night to shine. Set in the heart of Vancouver at the beautifully restored Odd Fellows Hall—celebrating over 100 years of music, community, and vintage charm —you’ll be dancing under century-old beams with a crowd that knows how to swing! Expect: Gatsby 'n Sassy style, One-night-only drinks and snacks available, Live music that swings, struts, and sizzles, A floor-friendly vibe for all your fancy or not so fancy footwork, Dance instruction from Swing dance club starts 7:00 PM (get there at 6:45pm please!), A historic venue that brings the era to life, Get your wiggle on - Live band starts 8:00 PM, Come dressed to impress or ready to move—just don’t miss your chance to dance, sip, and celebrate a night like they used to make ‘em! Barnstormer is a favourite EVENT/CORPORATE hire for Gatsby & Speakeasy themed events, so there's only time for a few public Live & Local shows. Charitable donations from ticket sales, food, and beverages will support the Odd Fellows Benevolence, which provides weekly Sunday breakfasts and a winter warming centre for the homeless.
location: 3301 Douglas, Victoria, BC V8Z 3L2, CA

description: Argentinian/Uruguayan tango, folk, and beyond at the Mary Winspear Centre in Sidney this November 10th! Ticketing information below. Date and time Monday, November 10 · 7:30 - 9pm PST. Doors at 7pm Location Mary Winspear Centre 2243 Beacon Avenue Sidney, BC V8L 1W9 Get directions Lineup Payadora Tango Ensemble Good to know Highlights all ages In person Doors at 7:00 PM Refund Policy No refunds Highlights all ages In person Doors at 7:00 PM Refund Policy No refunds About this event Arts • Other Tickets on sale now! Information below. “The beloved ensemble that is tango and beyond. It is world. It is classical. It is jazz. It is tango…a delicious swirl of music that is the Payadora Ensemble.” – Classical 96.3 FM Award-winning Canadian chamber music ensemble Payadora performs original compositions and arrangements drawing from Argentinian/Uruguayan tango and folk music. These musical powerhouses have combined tango with their classical, jazz and world music backgrounds to create something entirely new. Payadora draws from the height of Buenos Aires’ tango tradition, including compositions by De Caro, Pugliese, Troilo, and Salgan, and the masterful, contemporary sounds of Astor Piazzolla and beyond. Officially endorsed by the Argentinian Consulate in Toronto for its adherence to the spirit of tango, Payadora’s performances convey joy, virtuosity, humour, and intense passion. Payadora has presented concerts and sold-out shows around the world. They have collaborated with the London Symphonia, the Cathedral Bluffs Symphony, the Hannaford Street Silver Band, and the PointeTango Dance Company. Their critically-acclaimed album Silent Tears: The Last Yiddish Tango won the 2024 Folk Music Ontario Award and reached #1 on the World Music Charts in Europe. They have been named on “Best of” lists on NPR’s Rhythm Atlas, Finnish National Radio and CBC Classical. Payadora were also nominated for the Folk Music Awards as “Best Performing Artists.” They released Legend of Carau in 2025, based on the Argentinian folk tale. Now, they return to Victoria after their last appearance at the 2022 World Accordion and Tango Festival! This stellar lineup features some of the most respected chamber musicians in Canada: Rebekah Wolkstein violin/vocals , Drew Jurecka bandoneon/violin/mandolin , Joseph Phillips bass/guitar , and Clark Schaufele piano . TICKETS On sale September 12! $47 Reserved Seating | $42 VJS Members (plus service charges) Available Through: Mary Winspear Centre 250-656-0275 | marywinspear.ca 2243 Beacon Ave. Sidney, BC Tags Canada Events British Columbia Events Things to do in Sidney, Canada Sidney Performances Sidney Arts Performances #arts #folk #tango #sidney #payadora #victoriajazzsociety Organized by Victoria Jazz Society Followers -- Events -- Hosting -- Contact Follow Report this event Unavailable Use Eventbrite Create Events Pricing Event Marketing Platform Eventbrite Mobile Ticket App Eventbrite Check-In App Eventbrite App Marketplace Event Registration Software Community Guidelines FAQs Sitemap Plan events Sell Tickets Online Performing Arts Ticketing Software Sell Concert Tickets Online Event Payment System Solutions for Professional Services Event Management Software Halloween Party Planning Virtual Events Platform QR Codes for Event Check-In Post your event online Find events Browse Sidney Events Get the Eventbrite App Connect with us Report This Event Help Center Terms Privacy CA Privacy Notice Accessibility Community Guidelines Manage Cookie Preferences Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information Privacy Eventbrite + Ticketfly © 2025 Eventbrite
